intro: Plagiotaxis velutina, commonly known as the velvet twiner, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of South America. It features heart-shaped, velvety leaves that give it its common name, and it produces small, greenish-white flowers. The plant exhibits twining growth habit, using its tendrils to coil around supports as it climbs. Its botanical classification places it in the family Malvaceae, and it is characterized by its fibrous, woody stems. Plagiotaxis velutina is often found in humid, shaded environments within the rainforest understory.
